Andres,
It appears to be authentic and of about that period or a little later.  It looks more like Shoami work than Nara, maybe Aizu Shoami.  Nara work influenced a number of other groups.  The part of the composition with the mountain and pagoda is a Kaneie influence as well.

Jim 




  Dear All,

  Can someone give me their opinion on the tsuba depicted in these pics?

  http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru1.jpg
  http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru2.jpg

  The description is "Early edo period (circa 1650) tetsu (iron) tsuba for
  katana, maru gata, (round shaped), ko-nara school, ("old" Nara)".

  Do the pics match the description, especially as regards period and
  school? Look authentic?

  In advance, thanks. Sorry if this is a duplicate. I sent a similar one
  this morning but never saw it come through.

  Best Regards,

  Andres Pedraza
